problem_text: Let Γ be an almost polycyclic group with no non-trivial finite normal subgroups, and let k be a field. The complete ring of quotients Q(kΓ) is a matrix ring Mn(D) over a skew field. Conjecture: n is the least common multiple of the orders of the finite subgroups of Γ. An equivalent formulation (M. Lorenz) is as follows: ρ(G0(kΓ)) = ρ(G0(kΓ)F), where G0(kΓ) is the Grothendieck group of the category of finitely-generated kΓ-modules, G0(kΓ)F is the subgroup generated by classes of modules induced from finite subgroups of Γ, and ρ is the Goldie rank. There is a stronger conjecture: G0(kΓ) = G0(kΓ)F. G. A. Noskov
answer: The strong conjecture G0(kΓ) = G0(kΓ)F has been proved (J. A. Moody, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc., 17 (1987), 113–116).
